results.title: In search of adventure
results.creator_credit: Kirsty McGeoch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: After five years of study, Kirsty McGeoch had a law degree and a lifetime of career achievements ahead. Something, however, was telling her not to do it and to follow another path. Ultimately, this story is about honouring what fulfils the spirit.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kirsty McGeoch, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: A Nana fish
results.creator_credit: Mullie Watson, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description: Originally from Cherbourg, Mullie Watson tells of his fond memories of his nan, about the day they went fishing together and how an owl became his totem.

results.title: ACMI Animation Open Studios: three weekends in September and October 2007
results.creator_credit: Jason White and ACMI Content Development
results.brief_description: Three animators - Dave Jones, Nick Hilligoss, Steve Piscopo - participated in three weekends over September and October 2007 in the ACMI Animation Open Studios (as part of Pixar) sharing their secrets with people of all ages. Using a combination of moving image, stills and animation to a music soundtrack, this is a record of what took place.
results.title_for_label: ACMI Animation Open Studios: three weekends in September and October 2007
results.description: Three animators - Dave Jones, Nick Hilligoss, Steve Piscopo - participated in three weekends over September and October 2007 in the ACMI Animation Open Studios (as part of Pixar) sharing their secrets with people of all ages. results.title: Polo
results.brief_description:
Do nightmares come true? In a tale of a dark strange land, a silent outcast and a powerful robot, a creator will try to harness his creation.
Music by James Hodsons.

results.title: Queenscliff beaches; Our journey
results.creator_credit: Paul Jones and Queenscliff Primary School
results.brief_description:
This film is a learning outcome from the “Beaches” group student led investigation program at Queenscliff Primary School. It was undertaken as part of the 2007 Snapshots of Remote Communities Project and was overall winner of the Annual Sprockets and Flares Multimedia Awards.
A combination of softwares including Blue Sky technologies and artwork by the students was used in the creation of this work.
Two versions are included:
1. Queenscliff beaches - final product
2. Our journey - details the behind-the-scenes and process
